item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. How to monitor your local weather with Grafana (17 points | 4 comments)
2. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (153 points | 33 comments)
3. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (449 points | 145 comments)
4. Darktable 5.0.0 (97 points | 33 comments)
5. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (167 points | 114 comments)
6. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (251 points | 86 comments)
7. I wrote a Game Boy Advance game in Zig (251 points | 87 comments)
8. “A Course of Pure Mathematics” – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (239 points | 62 comments)
9. Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (149 points | 39 comments)
10. Agentarium: Creating social simulations with AI Agents (43 points | 7 comments)
11. U.S. Army Soldier Arrested in AT&T, Verizon Extortions (192 points | 100 comments)
12. Ruby-refrigerator: Freeze all core Ruby classes (82 points | 24 comments)
13. What Happens to Relicensed Open Source Projects and Their Forks? (64 points | 18 comments)
14. Reciprocal Approximation with 1 Subtraction (18 points | 10 comments)
15. Orbit by Mozilla (300 points | 290 comments)
16. Why it's hard to trust software, but you mostly have to anyway (44 points | 40 comments)
17. Deepseek – A Chinese AI startup whose latest model beat OpenAI’s o1 (113 points | 76 comments)
18. Seyfert Galaxies (38 points | 1 comment)
19. Symbolic Reference and Hardware Models in Python (7 points | discuss)
20. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (210 points | 33 comments)
21. The most stunning portrait that I have ever seen (12 points | 3 comments)
22. Dog Aging Project (89 points | 70 comments)
23. Lightstorm: Minimalistic Ruby Compiler (113 points | 16 comments)
24. Behind the Scenes: Alien Worlds – Jumpship over a tidally locked planet (69 points | 5 comments)
25. Coding Font Selection 'Tournament' (102 points | 80 comments)
26. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (107 points | 20 comments)
27. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (225 points | 100 comments)
28. Beyond Gradient Averaging in Parallel Optimization (87 points | 31 comments)
29. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (198 points | 63 comments)
30. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (985 points | 86 comments)
